fields.Description/Abstract:
<p>I was selected as one of 20 participants in the Idaho State Board of Education's<br>prestigious Idaho OPAL Fellows Program. This program, supported by the Wiki<br>Education Foundation's Wiki Scholars Program, provides in-depth training on open<br>pedagogy and advocacy. Through a series of intensive online modules and weekly Zoom<br>meetings, I acquired expertise in the Wikipedia ecosystem. As part of this public scholarship, I made a significant contribution to the scholarly record by creating the<br>first Wikipedia and Wikidata entries for Natalie Grant Wraga, a Russian-born historian<br>who played a crucial role in U.S. foreign policy during the Cold War. Wraga's work on<br>Russian disinformation practices has significantly influenced my own research in this<br>area.</p>
<p></p>
